newsitem.title: FRANCE: Gadget-packed Bond cars to star at Paris show.
newsitem.headline: Gadget-packed Bond cars to star at Paris show.

text.p: The deadly, gadget-packed cars driven by film masterspy James Bond will be displayed in a special exhibit at the Paris Car Show in October, organisers said on Wednesday.

The display will feature trucks, motorcycles and even a tank with ejectible seats and missile launchers that helped Bond elude his sinister enemies in 17 films ranging from "Dr. No" to the recent blockbuster "GoldenEye."
"We think the exhibit should attract a lot of people," chief organiser Bernard Vernier-Palliez told a news conference.
The show, which opens on October 3 and runs for 10 days, will feature more than 850 more conventional vehicles -- 30 shown for the first time -- made in 34 countries.

It will also feature a special Ladies' Night on October 7 in which thousands of readers of women's magazines published by France's Hachette-Filippachi will choose among 10 models to select the ideal woman's car.
